inspiracio.servlet.jsp
Class PageContextFactory

java.lang.Object
  inspiracio.servlet.jsp.PageContextFactory

public class PageContextFactory
extends Object

The page context factory maintains a variable for each thread, and puts the page context there. So we can access the page context from anywhere on the same thread.

To establish the page context for a thread, call setPageContext, at the start of the request.

          Get the page context for this request.

Method Detail

setPageContext

public static void setPageContext(PageContext pc)
At the start of a request, call this to set an appropriate page context for the request. If you forget, the request will use a page context of a previous request (wrong).

DWR requests cannot and needn't set the page context: see getPageContext().

setServletPageContext

public static void setServletPageContext(HttpServlet servlet,
                                         HttpServletRequest request,
                                         HttpServletResponse response)
At the start of a request to a servlet, call this to set an appropriate page context for the request. If you forget, the request will use a page context of a previous request (wrong).

Parameters:
servlet - the calling servlet
request - the current request
response - the current response

getPageContext

public static PageContext getPageContext()
Get the page context for this request.

If this request is a DWR request, this method will return a page context good for DWR, otherwise whatever page context was last set.

setPageContextMaker

public static void setPageContextMaker(PageContextMaker m)
Sets the make of page contexts. If we use PageContextFactory in environments that are not web applications, put a maker here.

For example, when using page context factory in a java application, for using the session as a map of global variables.
